donor_name: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
outputs.output_descr: Sao Tomé is a small island state within the lower income bracket of African nations, with 53.8 percent of its population living in poverty. The program supported by this grant seeks to develop services and activities that prevent and treat sexually transmitted infections and HIV, provide prevention of mother-to-child transmission of HIV services to HIV-positive pregnant women and provide second-line treatment to HIV-positive individuals. The program targets vulnerable groups with information and behavioral change activities. Additionally, the program assists in the development of capacities of the health services to reduce the transmission of blood-borne diseases, including HIV, hepatitis and syphilis by training health staff, developing the capacities of laboratories and raising awareness of blood donors. The program is also offering education and clothing support to orphans and caring families to remove some of the burden created by HIV.
outputs.output_title: Support à la lutte au VIH/SIDA

project_descr: RENFORCEMENT DE LA REPONSE NATIONALE A LA LUTTE CONTRE LE VIH/SIDA A SAO TOME ET PRINCIPE
